etymologies: late 19th century: palolo from Samoan or Tongan

definitions: a marine bristle worm which swarms in response to changes in light intensity, particularly that of the moon. The worm's posterior segments detach themselves and swim to the surface where the reproductive cells are released into the sea.

notes.text: Several species in Eunicidae and other families, in particular the Samoan palolo worm (Palola or 'Eunice' viridis), which occurs on South Pacific reefs

shortDefinitions: marine bristle worm which swarms in response to changes in light intensity
